title: Cultivating Courage
devotional:
Eliza had always been the quiet one, content to blend into the background. She admired the bold strokes of artists, the powerful voices of speakers, and the unwavering conviction of leaders. Yet, she felt a knot of fear tighten in her stomach at the mere thought of stepping outside her carefully constructed comfort zone. When asked to lead the community garden project, Eliza nearly declined. The thought of organizing volunteers, managing budgets, and making decisions terrified her. What if she failed? What if she disappointed everyone?

One evening, while wrestling with her anxieties, Eliza stumbled upon a passage in Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.' The words resonated deep within her soul, a gentle reminder that courage wasn't the absence of fear, but the willingness to act despite it. It wasn't about being fearless, but about trusting in God's presence and provision.

Taking a deep breath, Eliza accepted the challenge. She started small, seeking advice from experienced gardeners and delegating tasks to willing volunteers. There were setbacks, of course—unexpected weeds, a shortage of supplies, and disagreements among the team. But with each obstacle, Eliza found her confidence growing, fueled by the unwavering belief that God had called her to this task. She learned that courage wasn't a sudden burst of bravery, but a slow, steady burn of faith.

As the garden flourished, so did Eliza. She discovered a hidden strength she never knew she possessed, a resilience born from trusting in God's plan. She realized that courage wasn't about being perfect, but about being willing to step out in faith, knowing that God would be with her every step of the way. It’s remembering that the call isn't for you to have it all figured out, it’s a call to be obedient and courageous and leave the rest to God. It's not about pretending the giant isn't there, it's about knowing Whose you are when you face it.
image_description: A newly sprouting vegetable garden with neat rows of plants and a wooden sign that reads "Community Garden".
insights: Joshua 1:9 is a powerful reminder of God's promise to be with us, encouraging us to be strong and courageous. This verse was spoken to Joshua as he took over leadership after Moses, a daunting task filled with uncertainty and responsibility. Just as God was with Joshua, He promises to be with us, empowering us to overcome our fears and step into the roles He has called us to fulfill. The passage doesn't promise an easy path, but it assures us of God's constant presence and support. Consider that you have already been called, and your next mission starts the moment you accept the call.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often allow fear to hold me back from pursuing Your calling. Help me to remember that true courage comes not from myself, but from Your presence within me. Grant me the strength to overcome my anxieties and step out in faith, trusting that You will be with me every step of the way. Thank you for Your unwavering love and support. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What fears are holding you back from pursuing God's calling in your life? How can you actively cultivate courage by trusting in God's presence and provision? What small step can you take today to move outside your comfort zone and embrace the challenges God has set before you?
